segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the Product Data Message by means of its name and number and when necessary its function. Data element 1225 may be used to identify updates to a previously sent PRODAT message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the Product Data Message date. The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date/time/period requires to be logically related to another specified data item, for example the availability date for a specified line item (DTM following LIN).

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating country of origin.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, A segment providing the product family name commonly used with all products identified within the message in free format and when necessary identifying the language used. It may be repeated as well to provide the name in other languages.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed relevant for all products described in the actual message but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Product group information
segment.documentation: PGI, A segment to identify a product group, price group or tariff group which is applicable to the whole message.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify currencies and relevant details for the rate of exchange.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to identify technical rules applicable for all products contained in the message and the rules' issue dates.

segment.name: Technical rules
segment.documentation: TRU, A segment identifying technical rules and conditions relevant for the whole message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the technical rules' issue date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify governmental or legal trade restrictions and relevant commodities.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment indicating that and which governmental or legal trade restrictions apply to all products described in the actual message.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment to identify the commodities relevant for the identified trade restrictions.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments for giving references and where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference by its type and number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and, or related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information relevant to the whole message.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the message. At least one NAD-segment should be provided, for example the manufacturer, the supplier or message generator. It is recommended that, if possible, only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments giving contact details of a specific person and, or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person and, or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments used to provide references and where necessary, their dates, related to the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference by its type and number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and, or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments providing common product characteristic and common characteristic details.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify common product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify common product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic values being physical measurements (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product family or group characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges. The MEA-segment is repeatable to allow the indication of a number of applicable measurable values, for example one electric appliance may be switchable for different voltages: 110V, 220V, 240V and 380V.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments that refers through an external file identification to each of the external files and giving additional information about each of the files.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, This segment will identify the external files by indicating the file name, file number and its sequence number in an exchange.

segment.name: Computer environment details
segment.documentation: CED, To give precise definitions of all necessary elements belonging to the configuration of a computer system, e.g. hardware, firmware, operating system, communication and application software.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving reference related to the file identified by a previous external file link identification segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will convey the date/time details of the external file.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation:
QTY, The size/volume of the external file identified in the previous external file link identification segment.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: SG13-SG14-SG15-SG16-SG17-SG18-SG20-SG21-SG23-SG28 A group of segments providing details of a single product. This segment group may be repeated to give subline details.

segment.name: Line item
segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the line item by the line item number and the product by its item number. Detailed product description can be specified using the following segment group: IMD-FTX. Data element 1229 may be used to identify the current line item updating the correspondent line item of a previously sent PRODAT message.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing either additional identification of the product specified in the LIN segment or any substitute product identification.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date and, or time or period details relating to the line item only, for example the date of first or last availability of specified product.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment enabling the physical measurements of the item to be specified where this is required for full identification of the product. Any measurements must refer to the product in its unpacked form, for example thickness of plastic film, length, weight, etc. Note: Measurement related to product characteristics are to be given by MEA within the item characteristic group.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling of the actual line item's product and additionally, if required, notifying hazardous materials.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to identify documents required with the identified product, for example the SAFHAZ message.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information on the actual product is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. The main purpose for using this FTX segment is to provide free format product description. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Product group information
segment.documentation: PGI, A segment to identify a product group, price group or tariff group which is applicable to the current line item only.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments for naming, identification and short description of the product specified within the PRODAT message line item. This group may be repeated to provide name and, or description in one or more other languages.

segment.name: Item description
segment.documentation: IMD, Segment providing the given product name in free format and when necessary identifying the language used. It may be repeated as well to provide name in one more other languages.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in clear form, to describe the named product and when necessary identifying the language used. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to identify technical rules applicable for the actual product and the rules' issue dates.

segment.name: Technical rules
segment.documentation: TRU, A segment identifying technical rules and conditions relevant for the whole message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the technical rules' issue date.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to identify governmental or legal trade restrictions and relevant commodities.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment indicating that and which governmental or legal trade restrictions apply to the actual product.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment to identify the commodities relevant for the identified trade restrictions.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to provide quantity for the specified product and where relevant related date and time information for example minimum delivery batch, indication of manufacturer's capacity within a given period.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify quantities related to the product.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating that date or time details relate to the quantity, for example number of time units needed to manufacture the specified product quantity.

segment.name: Status
segment.documentation: STS, A segment giving a status for the quantity, e.g. metered, estimated or corrected.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A segment group to specify the estimated value of an item only for budgetary purposes. This segment group may specify values over a given quantity range and for a current currency.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to specify the estimated value of an item for information purposes only.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify the currency of the value.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to specify the quantity range where the estimated value is applicable.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments providing product characteristic and-product characteristic details.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify common product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic values being physical measurements (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges. The MEA-segment is repeatable to allow the indication of a number of applicable measurable values, for example one electric appliance may be switchable for different voltages: 110V, 220V, 240V and 380V.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments providing information on origin and, or special conditions applicable to the product and - if required - relevant percentages.

segment.name: Additional information
segment.documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the product is subject to special conditions owing to origin, customs preference or commercial factors.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment providing a percentage and percentage basis related to the additional information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments giving references related to the product specified in the LIN segment.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference related to the product by its number and type and where appropriate a line within a document.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and, or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying names and addresses of the parties related to the identified product, in coded or clear form, and their functions for example supplier, warehouse, service. It is recommended that, if possible, only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference related to the party described in the preceding NAD segment.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment enabling the specification of quantities required to satisfy the specified level of service for a specific party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments giving contact details of a specific person and, or department within the party identified in the NAD segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person and, or department, and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments containing information about dangerous goods.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment providing dangerous goods information by using relevant dangerous goods identification.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify quantity for the given dangerous goods.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in clear form, to identify dangerous goods. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments identifying product specific packaging of the goods identified in the line item, its physical dimensions and marks (for example special packaging relevant for the product).

segment.name: Package
segment.documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number of packages and the physical type of packaging for the product, for example, package type.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment,-for example cube or gross weight, stack factor.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the type of quantity and the quantity related to the package, for example quantity of products packed into the package.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment providing information on required handling of the actual line item's product depending on packaging and additionally, if required, notifying hazardous materials.

segment.name: Package identification
segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment, for example item number of packaging unit.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments to indicate the ingredients of the packaging used to pack a product and to provide the quantity of material used in this actual packaging. This group needs to be repeated for the ingredients as relevant.

segment.name: Component details
segment.documentation: COD, A segment to identify the ingredients used for packaging.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to give the measurements of the identified ingredient as used for packaging.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to give the quantity of the identified ingredient as used for packaging.

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to give the percentage of the ingredient within the packaging.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments to specify hierarchical connections from the given product to higher or lower leveled products.

segment.name: Hierarchy information
segment.documentation: HYN, A segment to identify hierarchical connections from the given product to higher or lower leveled products and its function within the logistic chain. Data element 1229 may be used to identify the current line item's hierarchical structure updating the correspondent line item's hierarchical structure of a previously sent PRODAT message.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing either additional identification of the product specified in the HYN segment or any substitute product identification.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the child product's quantity contained within the identified parent product.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information on the actual product and its hierarchical connections.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments to provide references linked to the hierarchical item and where necessary the reference date.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference linked to the hierarchical item, for example the drawing number on a wiring diagram.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date and, or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments to identify characteristics depending on the product's use within the specified hierarchy.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify product characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic values being physical measurements (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges. The MEA-segment is repeatable to allow the indication of a number of applicable measurable values, for example one electric appliance may be switchable for different voltages: 110V, 220V, 240V and 380V.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A segment group to specify party dependent information for the actual product in the given hierarchy.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment identifying a party preferably in coded form to which specific product and hierarchical item characteristics apply.

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional identification(s) of the hierarchically linked product that are specific to the identified party, for example an additional number from another origin to identify the higher or lower leveled product relevant to the identified party.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the child product's quantity contained within the identified parent product if specially defined by the named party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments to identify characteristics depending on the product's use within the hierarchy specific to the identified party.

segment.name: Characteristic/class id
segment.documentation: CCI, A segment to identify product characteristic and, or the characteristic name and characteristic relevance for the business process.

segment.name: Characteristic value
segment.documentation: CAV, A segment to specify product-characteristic by value in either coded form or in free format.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment indicating characteristic values being physical measurements (including measurable quantities and percentages) related to specified product characteristics (for example voltage, percentage of material contained) and where relevant measurement ranges. The MEA-segment is repeatable to allow the indication of a number of applicable measurable values, for example one electric appliance may be switchable for different voltages: 110V, 220V, 240V and 380V.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments that refers through an external file identification to each of the external files and giving additional information about each of the files.

segment.name: External file link identification
segment.documentation: EFI, This segment will identify the external files by indicating the file name, file number and its sequence number in an exchange.

segment.name: Computer environment details
segment.documentation: CED, To give precise definitions of all necessary elements belonging to the configuration of a computer system like hardware, firmware, operating system, communication and application software.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, To identify a communication number of a department or a person to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment giving reference related to the file, identified by a previous external file link identification segment.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, This segment will convey the date/time details of the external file.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, The size/volume of the external file identified in the previous external file link identification segment.
